OrgName: Data Services, Inc. (formerly known as Cendant Data Services, Inc.)
activities:
Affinion Data Services, Inc. acts as a Data Processor and processes data in accordance with instructions from the Data Controller.  Affinion Data Services, Inc. only supports business offerings of its European affiliates and/or former affiliates purely as a processor.  In doing so, it acts at the specific direction of the European affiliates and/or former affiliates.  Written instructions are provided by such affiliates and/or former affiliates outlining the authority granted to Affinion Data Services, Inc. as the Data Processor. 

The data transferred is on-line data, off-line data and manually processed data.  The data transferred to Affinion Data Services, Inc. includes customer data housed in the databases of the clients of its European affiliates and/or former affiliates.  The data will also be processed by Affinion Data Services, Inc. in the following way: managed hosting and off-line backups for recovery purposes which are stored on-site and archived off-site.  The manual processing is limited to use of the data in problem solving and movement of databases for normal operational upgrades, recoveries and other actions to assure integrity, security and operability of the servers as needed by its clients, affiliates, and/or former affiliates.  This is the necessary technical and database support required to assure continuous operation of the servers.  Manual handling is on a need-to-know basis by authorized operations staff, technical support persons, database administrators, network administrators, and security administrators and is only accessed for problem solving, backups and normal computer operations movement of data.

privacyprograms: Affinion Data Services, Inc. has instituted a self-regulatory program for ensuring verification and adherence to the safe harbor principles.  This may consist of regular information security reviews including privacy information reviews, physical security reviews, disaster recovery planning, testing and reviews, internal and external audits of security of Affinion Data Services, Inc., reviews performed by Affinion International Limited (the main client of Affinion Data Services, Inc.) and onsite and survey reviews by Affinion International Limited's clients.  This also consists of periodic certification/vulnerability assessments, which include periodic renewal and check pointing to assure maintenance of certification.  Vulnerability reviews by Affinion Group or its designated third parties are also performed periodically.  In addition, Affinion Group maintains Cybertrust enterprise-level certifications of its Trumbull, CT and Westerville, OH data centers.  The Cybertust certification processes provide for (among other things) a quarterly scan of our internet perimeter and annual re-certification validation and assessment of the Data Centers.
recoursemech: Affinion Data Services, Inc. commits to cooperation with the EU Data Protection authorities (DPAs) and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner
